title: Driver escaped unharmed after logs flew through the windscreen into his car
text:
The motorist drove his car into the back of a vehicle carrying logs (Picture: MEGA) A man has narrowly escaped death after dozens of logs smashed through his vehicle.

The driver suffered only minor cuts after the wood missed him by a matter of inches.

The accident happened when he rear-ended a truck in Georgia, USA, on October 11.

The felled trees smashed through his windscreen and forced their way through his SUV.

The driver’s head ended up in a gap between the logs (Picture: MEGA) Whitfield County Fire chief Edward O’Brien said the man was leaning down to get something when he ran into the log truck.

Images on the fire department’s Facebook page show the driver’s seat just inches away from the logs.

Mr O’Brien said that the driver escaped serious injury or even death because he was not in an upright position.

Because of this, his head ended up in a gap between the logs.

Mr O’Brien added: ‘It was as if it was almost created just for his head.’

Firefighters cut through 30 to 40 logs before they could start to open the car and rescue the man.

The unnamed man was helped out of the car after about 10 minutes.
description: A man has narrowly escaped death after dozens of logs smashed through his vehicle. The driver suffered only minor cuts after the wood missed him by a matter of inches....
